projects.description: Secure, private Kolab accounts hosted in Switzerland for 10 CHF per month.
projects.notes:
MyKolab is hosted in Switzerland and benefits from the [strong Swiss privacy laws](https://MyKolab.com/privacy). It is run exclusively with free software and using the service supports the development of Kolab. 
Also, you can export all your data at any time.

projects.description: P2P digital currency with no central authority.
projects.notes: Please note that new, digital currencies may be very volatile. Complete loss of your investment is possible for a number of reasons (software errors or attacks, identity theft, etc.). Be prepared!
projects.name: Bitcoin

projects.description: Peer-to-peer cryptocurrency and open source software project released under the MIT/X11 license. Inspired by and technically nearly identical to Bitcoin (BTC), Litecoin creation and transfer is based on an open source protocol and is not managed by any central authority. Litecoin is intended by its developers to improve upon Bitcoin and offers three key differences.
projects.notes: Please note that new, digital currencies may be very volatile. Complete loss of your investment is possible for a number of reasons (software errors or attacks, identity theft, etc.). Be prepared!
projects.name: Litecoin

projects.description: Multi-platform email application with mail encryption through the Enigmail add-on.
projects.notes:
Thunderbird does not encrypt your email by default. [Here is a guide](https://securityinabox.org/en/thunderbird_main) by Security In A Box to encrypting your email with Mozilla Thunderbird, GNU Privacy Guard (GPG), and Enigmail.

Thunderbird can optionally connect over Tor with the TorBirdy addon.

While Thunderbird can be used as a chat and IRC client, it does not offer encrypted messaging.
projects.name: Mozilla Thunderbird

projects.description: Install and enable this plugin in Pidgin for encrypted chat.
projects.name: Off-the-Record Messaging

projects.description: Free universal instant messaging client.
projects.notes:
Pidgin stores your IM account passwords in [plain text](https://developer.pidgin.im/wiki/PlainTextPasswords). You can avoid this by (1) not saving your password in Pidgin, (2) encrypting your file system with software like [TrueCrypt](http://www.truecrypt.org/), or (3) storing your Pidgin password securely with the Debian package [pidgin-gnome-keyring](https://code.google.com/p/pidgin-gnome-keyring/).

Pidgin with OTR and dbus enabled has a local security bug. See the [upstream bug report](https://developer.pidgin.im/ticket/14830) for more information and possible workarounds.
projects.name: Pidgin

projects.description: Multi-platform IM client for power users with built-in OTR support.
projects.name: Psi+

projects.description: Secure P2P communications platform offering IM, forums, VoIP, file sharing, and more.
projects.notes:

For those of you without a server, RetroShare is probably the easiest way to start your own encrypted social network.
projects.name: RetroShare

There is also a DuckDuckGo hidden service at [3g2upl4pq6kufc4m.onion](http://3g2upl4pq6kufc4m.onion) for Tor users.
